title: How to Make a Jack Daniel's Marinade

steps.headline: Prepare and measure all of the ingredients.
First pour soy sauce in the bowl.
Add a dash of black pepper.
Now, add 1/4 cup of Jack Daniel's Whiskey.
Combine everything using a wire whisk.
Use the marinade immediately.
steps.description: Set aside a small amount for basting. Marinate any meat, such as chicken, pork, or beef overnight. Marinate any seafood, such as shrimp for about 30 to 60 minutes.

steps.headline: Use any unused marinade as a baste.
steps.description: About 3 minutes before the food is done grilling, use a baste brush and brush the marinade onto the food.

text: Prepare and measure all of the ingredients.  First pour soy sauce in the bowl.  Mix soy sauce with mustard.  Add minced green onions.  Add 1 teaspoon of salt.  Add a dash of black pepper.  Add the brown sugar.  Now, add 1/4 cup of Jack Daniel's Whiskey.  Combine everything using a wire whisk.  Use the marinade immediately. Set aside a small amount for basting. Marinate any meat, such as chicken, pork, or beef overnight. Marinate any seafood, such as shrimp for about 30 to 60 minutes. Use any unused marinade as a baste. About 3 minutes before the food is done grilling, use a baste brush and brush the marinade onto the food.
sentences: Prepare and measure all of the ingredients.
First pour soy sauce in the bowl.
Add a dash of black pepper.
Now, add 1/4 cup of Jack Daniel's Whiskey.
Combine everything using a wire whisk.
Set aside a small amount for basting.
Marinate any meat, such as chicken, pork, or beef overnight.
Marinate any seafood, such as shrimp for about 30 to 60 minutes.
Use any unused marinade as a baste.
About 3 minutes before the food is done grilling, use a baste brush and brush the marinade onto the food.
